chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
f: bool -> bool -> bool
l: lb

Goal:
lb_pointwise nil l = map (f ⟘) l

Premises:
map : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> list A -> list B
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
lb_pointwise = fix lb_pointwise (l m : lb) {struct l} : lb := match l with | nil => match m with | nil => nil | _ :: _ => map (f ⟘) m end | x :: l0 => match m with | nil => map (fun x0 : bool => f x0 ⟘) l | y :: m0 => f x y :: lb_pointwise l0 m0 end end : lb -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_pointwise (_ _)%list_scope
lb_pointwise_left : forall l : lb, lb_pointwise l nil = map (fun x : bool => f x ⟘) l
map_ext_in_iff : map ?f ?l = map ?g ?l < -> (forall a : ?A, In a ?l -> ?f a = ?g a) where ?A : [f : bool -> bool -> bool l : lb |- Type] ?B : [f : bool -> bool -> bool l : lb |- Type] ?f : [f : bool -> bool -> bool l : lb |- ?A -> ?B] ?g : [f : bool -> bool -> bool l : lb |- ?A -> ?B] ?l : [f : bool -> bool -> bool l : lb |- list ?A]
Inductive ascii : Set := Ascii : bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> Ascii.ascii Arguments Ascii.Ascii (_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _)%bool_scope
andb = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then b2 else ⟘ : bool -> bool -> bool Arguments andb (_ _)%bool_scope
Ring.bool_eq = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then b2 else negb b2 : bool -> bool -> bool Arguments Ring.bool_eq (_ _)%bool_scope
Bool.le = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then b2 = ⟙ else True : bool -> bool -> Prop Arguments Bool.le (_ _)%bool_scope
xorb = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then if b2 then ⟘ else ⟙ else if b2 then ⟙ else ⟘ : bool -> bool -> bool Arguments xorb (_ _)%bool_scope
map_eq_nil : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A), map f l = nil -> l = nil
ZMicromega.Zunsat = RingMicromega.check_inconsistent BinNums.Z0 Zbool.Zeq_bool BinInt.Z.leb : RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z -> bool
ext_in_map : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), map f l = map g l -> forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a
map_ext_in : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), (forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a) -> map f l = map g l
map_ext : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B), (forall a : A, f a = g a) -> forall l : list A, map f l = map g l
map_ext_Forall : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => f x = g x) l -> map f l = map g l
Tauto.map_simpl : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A), map f l = match l with | nil => nil | a :: l0 => f a :: map f l0 end
lb_pointwise_nil = eq_refl : lb_pointwise nil nil = nil
Ring.BoolTheory = {| Ring_theory.Radd_0_l := fun x : bool => if x as b return ((if b then ⟙ else ⟘) = b) then eq_refl else eq_refl; Ring_theory.Radd_comm := fun x : bool => if x as b return (forall y : bool, xorb b y = xorb y b) then fun y : bool => if y as b return (xorb ⟙ b = xorb b ⟙) then eq_refl else eq_refl else fun y : bool => if y as b return (xorb ⟘ b = xorb b ⟘) then eq_refl else eq_refl; Ring_theory.Radd_assoc := fun x : bool => if x as b return (forall y z : bool, xorb b (xorb y z) = xorb (xorb b y) z) then fun y : bool => if y as b return (forall z : bool, xorb ⟙ (xorb b z) = xorb (xorb ⟙ b) z) then fun z...
filter_map : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l < -> map f l = map g l
Ring.bool_ring_ring_lemma2 : forall (n : nat) (lH : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (l : lb), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist ⟘ ⟙ xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (Ring_theory.IDphi (R:=bool)) Ring_theory.id_phi_N (Ring_theory.pow_N ⟙ andb) l lH ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval ⟘ ⟙ xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (Ring_theory.IDphi (R:=bool)) Ring_theory.id_phi_N (Ring_theory.pow_N ⟙ andb) l pe = Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev ⟘ ⟙ xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) ⟘ ⟙ Ring.bool_eq (Ring_theory.IDphi (R:=bool)) (Ring_theory.get_sign_None (C:=bool)) l npe
ZMicromega.ZWeakChecker = RingMicromega.check_normalised_formulas BinNums.Z0 (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH) BinInt.Z.add BinInt.Z.mul Zbool.Zeq_bool BinInt.Z.leb : list (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z) -> RingMicromega.Psatz BinNums.Z -> bool Arguments ZMicromega.ZWeakChecker _%list_scope
map_map : forall (A B C : Type) (f : A -> B) (g : B -> C) (l : list A), map g (map f l) = map (fun x : A => g (f x)) l
Ring_polynom.Peq : forall C : Type, (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> bool
map_eq_app : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (l1 l2 : list B), map f l = l1 ++ l2 -> exists l1' l2' : list A, l = l1' ++ l2' /\ map f l1' = l1 /\ map f l2' = l2
map_last : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (a : A), map f (l ++ a :: nil) = map f l ++ f a :: nil
map_app : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l l' : list A), map f (l ++ l') = map f l ++ map f l'
Ring.bool_ring_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : lb) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr bool), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist ⟘ ⟙ xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (Ring_theory.IDphi (R:=bool)) Ring_theory.id_phi_N (Ring_theory.pow_N ⟙ andb) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval ⟘ ⟙ xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (Ring_theory.IDphi (R:=bool)) Ring_theory.id_phi_N (Ring_theory.pow_N ⟙ andb) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval ⟘ ⟙ xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (Ring_theory.IDphi (R:=bool)) Ring_theory.id_phi_N (Ring_theory.pow_N ⟙ andb) l pe2
